treatment.name: Donor Egg IVF
treatment.description: Surrogacy is a fertility arrangement where a woman (the surrogate) carries and delivers a baby for another person or couple. The process involves the following phases: 1.Initial Evaluation 2.Matching with a Surrogate 3.Legal Agreements 4.Medical and Psychological Screening 5.In Vitro Fertilization (IVF) and Embryo Transfer 6.Pregnancy and Prenatal Care 7.Birth and Legal Parentage This process allows individuals or couples to have a child with the help of a surrogate, providing an option for those unable to carry a pregnancy themselves.

treatment.name: Embryo Freezing
treatment.description: Embryo freezing, also known as embryo cryopreservation, is a fertility preservation method where embryos are frozen and stored for future use. The process involves the following phases: 1.Initial Evaluation 2.Ovarian Stimulation and Egg Retrieval 3.Fertilization 4.Embryo Culture 5.Embryo Freezing 6.Storage This process allows couples to preserve embryos for future use, providing the option to attempt pregnancy at a later time when conditions are more favorable.
